cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida / 235 miles S of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest and then turning north toward the western Florida Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle near/just east of Panama City, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch: Alabama/Florida border to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Navarre, FL to Wakulla/Jefferson County line; Storm Surge Warning: Indian Pass to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and northern Gulf Coast from the Florida Big Bend through the western Panhandle and Alabama
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: TAMPA FL (nearest site in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<5% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near PortMiami.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain bands on the east side of Fred could bring 3â€“5 inches of rain through Monday, with isolated higher totals over 4 inches and localized urban/flash-flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches; brief squalls possible.
